alert.note: Alert for Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Southampton, southwestern Prince George, central Sussex and southern Dinwiddie Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McKenney to 7 miles west of Stony Creek. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
